                                                                                                                                           underlying copy number variant (CNV) in respective individuals may
                                                                                                                                           allow not only for better counseling and anticipatory guidance but also
                                                                                                                                           for more speciﬁc therapeutic interventions in some cases. The use of
                                                                                                                                           CMA technology in prenatal diagnosis is emerging and promises higher
                                                                                                                                           sensitivity for several highly penetrant, clinically severe microdeletion
                                                                                                                                           and microduplication syndromes. Genetic counseling complements the
                                                                                                                                           diagnostic testing with CMA, given the presence of CNVs of uncertain
                                                                                                                                           clinical signiﬁcance, incomplete penetrance, and variable expressivity
                                                                                                                                           in some cases. While oligonucleotide arrays with high-density exonic
                                                                                                                                           coverage remain the gold standard for the detection of CNVs, single-
                                                                                                                                           nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) arrays allow for detection of consan-
                                                                                                                                           guinity and most cases of uniparental disomy and provide a higher sen-
                                                                                                                                           sitivity to detect low-level mosaic aneuploidies.
